20101222190803.000|20101222190804.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WELL, PHILLIP, IF  
20101222190804.000|20101222190806.000|CC1|THERE IS ANY GOOD NEWS AROUND   
20101222190806.000|20101222190808.000|CC1|HERE, IT'S THAT THE RAIN HAS

20101222190809.000|20101222190811.000|CC1|AS THEY SAY, THE DAMAGE IN THIS

20101222193050.000|20101222193050.000|CC1|CLEARING.

20101222193051.000|20101222193052.000|CC1|TYPE OF WEATHER PATTERN.        
20101222193052.000|20101222193053.000|CC1|DO NOT LET IT FOOL YOU.         
20101222193053.000|20101222193054.000|CC1|THE MORE SUNSHINE YOU GET NOW   
20101222193054.000|20101222193056.000|CC1|ON TOP OF THE COOL AIR.         
20101222193056.000|20101222193057.000|CC1|IT'S A BETTER THREAT FOR        
20101222193057.000|20101222193058.000|CC1|THUNDERSTORMS.                  
20101222193058.000|20101222193100.000|CC1|AS WE GO THROUGH THE AFTERNOON, 
20101222193100.000|20101222193102.000|CC1|WE COULD STILL SEE HEAVIER      
20101222193102.000|20101222193104.000|CC1|RAINFALL RATES THAN WE'VE SEEN. 
20101222193104.000|20101222193106.000|CC1|THE NATURE OF THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
20101222193106.000|20101222193106.000|CC1|THAT THEY ARE JUST              
20101222193106.000|20101222193108.000|CC1|UNPREDICTABLE IN NATURE AS IT   
20101222193108.000|20101222193109.000|CC1|IS.                             
20101222193109.000|20101222193110.000|CC1|WHERE THEY POP AND WHERE THEY

20101222193112.000|20101222193113.000|CC1|TO BE SEEN BUT WE'LL BE

20101222193116.000|20101222193118.000|CC1|THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HERE.     
20101222193118.000|20101222193119.000|CC1|TO THE SOUTH, SIMILAR SITUATION.
20101222193119.000|20101222193121.000|CC1|WE'RE STARTING TO SEE MORE      
20101222193121.000|20101222193122.000|CC1|BREAKS DOWN THERE.

20101222193123.000|20101222193125.000|CC1|THE MORE CLOUD COVER YOU SEE,   
20101222193125.000|20101222193127.000|CC1|THE LESS CHANCES THERE ARE MORE 
20101222193127.000|20101222193128.000|CC1|THUNDERSTORMS.                  
20101222193128.000|20101222193129.000|CC1|THE MORE SUNSHINE YOU GET
